description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to contribute to the development of a sustainable statistical system in Albania. A sustainable statistical system will facilitate decision-making based on relevant and reliable statistical information that meets domestic demands as well as EU standards.

Insatsen är en fortsättning på ett långsiktigt stöd till att bygga upp Albaniens statistikbyrå för att den ska svara mot inhemska behov och på sikt uppnå EU-standard. Det kommer sannolikt att bli nödvändigt att fortsätta stödet även efter denna insatsperiod, åtminstone till år 2020, för att det slutliga målet - EU-standard - ska uppnås över hela linjen. Bedömningen av denna insatsperiod är att de flesta resultaten kommer att uppnås och att INSTAT därmed tar ett stort steg mot EU-nivån. Inom vissa områden kommer man att redan under denna insatsperiod uppnå hållbarhet på sina produkter, medan andra kommer att kräva fortsatt kompetensutveckling. Alltmer används IT som verktyg i arbetet och bidrar till att sprida statistiken i samhället och öka transparensen. De största riskerna med insatsen bedöms vara politisk inblandning på INSTAT och att INSTAT inte kommer att få tillräckliga budgetmedel från den albanska statsbudgeten.

The proposed Statistical Cooperation project between the National Institute of Statsitics of Albania and Statistics Sweden for the period 2014-2017 to a total cost of 21 288 000 SEK includes capacity development of INSTAT in some statistical subject areas, to strenghthen management and information and communication technology. The overall objective is to contribute to the development of a sustainable statistical system in Albania that meets domestic demands as well as EU standards.

description.narrative: The contribution has assisted the Institute of Statistics in Albania (INSTAT), the main producer of official statistics and the coordinator of the national statistical system in Albania, to continuously increase its institutional capacity since 2014. An Official Statistical Programme (2017–2021) on the development and production of official statistics in Albania is currently being implemented in response to the demands of decision-makers and the European Union, who are dependent on relevant and reliable statistical information. The increased number of publications (from 78 in 2014 to 134 in 2017), the updated website and more data in the statistical database are all efforts to meet these demands. Addititonally through the support of Statistics Sweden, the implementing partner of the contribution, INSTAT has incresed its capacities in producing various statistics such as economic statistics, social statistics, environmental, agriculture and gender statistis. So, on economic statistics, INSTAT is now capable of producing and improving surveys in line with EU requirements. Capacity in social statistics is also very high. The Household Budget Survey is fully in line with EU standards and is used to reweight the CPI basket and to calculate the GDP. It also provides information for the policy makers regarding social protection. The annual gender booklet ‘Women and Men in Albania’ is produced independently by INSTAT and is well received by the general public. In environmental statistics is developed the Environmental Accounts, in which the Economy-Wide Material Flow Accounts have been produced and reported to Eurostat for the first time. By the end of 2017, INSTAT produced quality reports concerning all of the most important and popular statistics. These quality reports are in line with EU standards and are available on the website. The reports will be updated annually by the INSTAT without any technical assistance. The following activities were undertaken during the project phase.- 65 Short-term missions with 98 consultants- 9 study visits to Statistics Sweden- 3 Regional study visits to Kosovo and Serbia (the majority of regional activities are part of a regional project)- Development of a website layout and structure and integrated metadata (local)- Training in R (local) The total budget for the fourth project phase (October 2014–2017), as stated in the Service Purchase Agreement, was SEK 21 289 000, of which SEK 15 356 000 was allocated to the budget line for fees, SEK 3 833 000 was for reimbursable, SEK 2 022 000 was for assignment costs and SEK 78 000 was for unforeseen costs. The budget has not been utilized according to the initial plans. The main reason is that instead of the planned two long term advisor, only one was stationed in Albania most of the period. One long term advisor had to leave prematurely and it was decided not to replace him and to drop the agriculture statistics component from the project. Already in the first year of the project phase (Oct-14 – Dec-15) the project reported a lower utilization than planned, 29 per cent. The second year (31 Dec 2017) the total utilization of the estimated budget for the project phase was 51 per cent. Accordingly, the budget was revised for the budget year 2017. In relation to the initial budget, however, 83 per cent of the total budget has been utilized.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
